summary: Successfully tested JMRI Import functionality - all features working. Backend API parses JMRI XML correctly, frontend file upload and import flow works end-to-end, imported locomotives appear in the list.

issues: React hydration warning: <span> cannot be child of <tbody> - cosmetic issue, does not affect functionality

passed_tests: ✅ Backup page displays 3 action cards: Create Backup, Restore, Import JMRI
✅ 'Ir a Importar JMRI' button navigates to /jmri-import page
✅ JMRI Import page (/jmri-import) shows file upload area with drag-drop zone
✅ POST /api/import/jmri accepts XML content and returns imported locomotives
✅ Importing single valid JMRI XML file works correctly
✅ Importing multiple valid JMRI XML files works correctly
✅ Invalid XML without locomotive element is properly handled (skipped with error)
✅ Malformed XML is properly handled (skipped with error)
✅ Mixed valid/invalid XML files are processed correctly (imports valid, skips invalid)
✅ Empty array import returns success=false properly
✅ CV modifications from XML are stored in locomotive data
✅ JMRI import creates backup history entry with type 'jmri_import'
✅ Frontend file selection displays selected files in list
✅ Frontend import button appears after file selection
✅ Frontend import completes and shows success result with imported count
✅ Frontend shows imported locomotive details (brand, model, DCC address)
✅ 'Ver Locomotoras' link navigates to locomotives list
critical_code_review_comments: React hydration warning in Locomotives list (span inside tbody) - cosmetic, not blocking
seed_data_creation: None - used test prefixed data that was cleaned up
context_for_next_testing_agent: JMRI Import feature fully tested and working. Backend parses JMRI XML with locomotive attributes (mfg, roadName, roadNumber, dccAddress, decoder info, CV values). Frontend has file upload with multi-file support. Test file at /app/backend/tests/test_jmri_import.py can be used for regression testing.
